alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 11:51AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Marquette and Dickinson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. South Branch Ontonagon near Ewen affecting Ontonagon County. Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Republic. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.8 feet, Water reaches the level from April of 2002 * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EDT Tuesday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 04/08/1986. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 245 AM CDT /345 AM EDT/.
